definitions: having the shape or form of a hemisphere or half of a sphere
examples: The hemispherical dome topped the ancient building
They installed a hemispherical security camera

definitions: publicly announced or proclaimed, especially with great fanfare
praised or celebrated as important or noteworthy in advance
examples: The heralded arrival of the new technology excited investors
Their heralded speech disappointed many supporters
The heralded discovery changed our understanding of physics
She became the most heralded artist of her generation

meanings: relating to heraldry or coats of arms
definitions: relating to heraldry, the system of visual symbols used on coats of arms
examples: The heraldic symbols adorned the castle walls
They studied heraldic traditions of medieval Europe

definitions: relating to plants that have soft green stems rather than woody ones
examples: The herbaceous border bloomed throughout the summer months
These herbaceous perennials die back each winter

definitions: relating to or made from plants used in medicine or cooking
examples: She preferred herbal remedies to conventional medicine
The herbal tea helped soothe her throat

definitions: feeding only on plants and plant material, not eating meat
examples: The herbivorous dinosaurs had special teeth for grinding plants
Most herbivorous animals have longer digestive systems

definitions: genetically transmitted or capable of being transmitted from parent to offspring
passed down by legal right from one generation to another
examples: The hereditary disease affected multiple family members
Scientists studied hereditary traits in fruit flies
The hereditary title passed to his eldest son
They abolished the hereditary privileges of nobility

definitions: holding opinions or beliefs that go against established religious or other doctrine
examples: His heretical views challenged the church authorities
The heretical teachings spread despite official opposition

definitions: capable of being passed from parent to offspring through genetic transmission
examples: Intelligence shows some heritable characteristics in twin studies
The heritable traits were tracked across generations

definitions: having both male and female reproductive organs in one individual
examples: Many hermaphrodite species can self-fertilize when necessary
The hermaphrodite flowers contain both stamens and pistils

definitions: completely sealed so that no air can enter or escape
difficult to understand because of being obscure or esoteric
examples: The hermetic seal kept the contents fresh for years
They stored chemicals in hermetic containers
His hermetic poetry puzzled most readers
The hermetic philosophy required years of study

definitions: showing extreme courage and bravery, especially in dangerous situations
impressively grand in scale, ambition, or achievement beyond ordinary
examples: Her heroic rescue saved three children from drowning
The firefighters made heroic efforts against the blaze
The project required heroic amounts of dedication and resources
They achieved heroic progress despite limited funding

definitions: tentative, unsure, or slow in acting or speaking due to uncertainty
examples: She gave a hesitant smile before answering
His hesitant steps showed his fear of falling

definitions: not conforming to accepted or orthodox standards, beliefs, or practices
examples: His heterodox economic theories challenged mainstream thinking
The heterodox interpretation sparked academic debate

definitions: consisting of dissimilar or diverse ingredients, parts, or elements
examples: The heterogeneous mixture contained sand and salt
America has a heterogeneous population from many cultures

definitions: sexually attracted to people of the opposite sex or gender
examples: The heterosexual couple had been married for ten years
Most heterosexual relationships follow certain social patterns

definitions: enabling someone to discover or learn something for themselves through exploration
examples: The heuristic approach helped students understand complex concepts
They used heuristic methods to solve the problem

definitions: shaped or cut with an axe, pick, or other sharp tool
examples: The roughly hewn beams supported the cabin roof
They climbed steps hewn from solid rock

definitions: relating to or using the hexadecimal number system
relating to or associated with magic curses or spells
examples: The hex code defined the exact color values
Programmers often work with hex numbers
The old woman claimed to have hex powers
They believed a hex had been placed on them

definitions: relating to or using a number system with base 16
examples: The hexadecimal color code specified the exact shade
Computer memory addresses use hexadecimal notation

definitions: having a shape with six straight sides and six angles
examples: The hexagonal tiles created an interesting pattern
Bees build hexagonal cells in their honeycombs

definitions: in a state of deep sleep or reduced activity during winter
examples: The hibernating bears won't emerge until spring
Scientists studied hibernating animals' metabolic changes

definitions: characteristic of unsophisticated country people, often used disparagingly
examples: He resented their hick town stereotypes about him
The movie portrayed hick characters in offensive ways

definitions: kept out of sight or concealed from view or knowledge
not openly acknowledged or displayed but present nonetheless
examples: The hidden treasure remained undiscovered for centuries
They found hidden cameras throughout the building
Her hidden talents surprised everyone at the competition
The agreement contained hidden costs and fees

definitions: extremely ugly or unpleasant to look at or contemplate
examples: The hideous mask frightened all the children
She wore a hideous dress to the party

definitions: arranged in order of rank, with each level subordinate to the one above
examples: The company maintained a strict hierarchical structure
Hierarchical systems often limit communication flow

definitions: relating to a system of writing using pictures and symbols, especially ancient Egyptian
examples: The hieroglyphic inscriptions covered the tomb walls
Scholars decoded the hieroglyphic messages

definitions: intellectual or rarefied in taste, often associated with elite culture
examples: The highbrow literary magazine attracted few readers
His highbrow tastes alienated ordinary audiences

definitions: situated at a greater height or more elevated position
more advanced in degree, quality, or complexity
examples: The higher shelves required a ladder to reach
Birds flew to higher branches for safety
She pursued higher education after her bachelor's degree
The court made a higher ruling on appeal

definitions: relating to or characteristic of mountainous or elevated regions
examples: The highland cattle thrived in cold climates
They explored remote highland villages in Scotland

definitions: extremely funny and causing great amusement or loud laughter
examples: The comedian's hilarious jokes had everyone laughing
We watched a hilarious movie last night

definitions: having many hills or characterized by numerous slopes and elevations
examples: The hilly terrain made cycling exhausting
San Francisco is famous for its hilly streets

definitions: situated at the back or rear, especially of an animal's body
examples: The horse's hind legs were extremely powerful
The dog stood on its hind feet

definitions: creating difficulties that result in delay or obstruction of progress
examples: The hindering regulations slowed business development significantly
Bad weather proved a hindering factor

definitions: following or aware of the latest trends and developments in fashion or culture
examples: The hip new restaurant attracted young professionals
She always wore hip clothes from boutiques

definitions: employed to work for payment, especially temporarily or for specific services
examples: The hired workers finished harvesting the crops
They used hired cars during their vacation

definitions: famous or important in history, or potentially so in the future
examples: The historic agreement ended decades of conflict
We visited several historic sites in Boston

definitions: relating to or concerning past events and their study or documentation
based on or concerned with events in history rather than legend
examples: The historical records showed population changes over time
She conducted historical research in the archives
The novel blended historical facts with fiction
Historical evidence supported their claims

definitions: sounding rough and harsh, typically from shouting or illness
examples: His hoarse voice showed he had been yelling
She sounded hoarse after the cold

definitions: gray or white in color, especially from age or frost
old and trite from overuse, lacking freshness or originality
examples: His hoary beard made him look ancient
The hoary frost covered the morning grass
They repeated the same hoary jokes every year
The professor shared hoary wisdom with students

definitions: noticeably contrived, artificial, or excessively sentimental in an obvious way
examples: The movie's hokey dialogue made audiences cringe
His hokey attempts at romance failed miserably

definitions: characterized by treating the whole person or system rather than just parts
examples: The doctor took a holistic approach to treatment
They adopted holistic solutions for environmental problems

definitions: having a hole or empty space inside rather than being solid
lacking real value, sincerity, or substance despite appearances
examples: The hollow tree trunk served as animal shelter
They discovered hollow walls behind the paneling
His hollow promises meant nothing to voters
The victory felt hollow without her there

definitions: relating to or produced using holography, creating three-dimensional images
examples: The holographic display amazed museum visitors
Scientists developed new holographic storage systems

definitions: dedicated or consecrated to God or a religious purpose
morally and spiritually excellent, pure, or virtuous
examples: The holy shrine attracted thousands of pilgrims
They observed holy days with prayer
She lived a holy life devoted to others
The monks pursued holy wisdom through meditation

definitions: grown or produced in one's own garden, region, or country
examples: They served homegrown vegetables from their garden
The company promoted homegrown talent over outsiders

definitions: unattractive in appearance, plain or unprepossessing looking
simple and unpretentious but cozy and comfortable in atmosphere
examples: She felt homely compared to her beautiful sister
His homely features belied his charming personality
The homely cottage provided warm shelter
They enjoyed homely pleasures like reading

definitions: made at home rather than in a store or factory
examples: Her homemade cookies tasted better than store-bought
They sold homemade crafts at the fair

definitions: relating to homeopathy, treating disease with minute doses of natural substances
examples: She preferred homeopathic remedies to conventional drugs
The homeopathic treatment required patient dilution

definitions: experiencing a longing for one's home during absence from it
examples: The homesick student called her parents every day
He felt homesick during his first deployment
